psl2map.py - build a mappping from blat alignments¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This scripts reads psl formatted alignments and builds a map of queries to targets. The mapping can be restricted by different measures of uniqueness.

If polyA processing is turned on, the non-overlapping terminus of each read will be checked if they are mostly A. If they are, the query coverage will be adjusted appropriately and the read flagged in the section polyA.

Usage¶

Example:

python <script_name>.py --help

Type:

python <script_name>.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: psl2map.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  --input-filename-queries=INPUT_FILENAME_QUERIES
                        fasta filename with queries - required for polyA
                        analysis [none].
  --polyA               detect polyA tails [False].
  -p OUTPUT_FILENAME_PATTERN, --output-filename-pattern=OUTPUT_FILENAME_PATTERN
                        OUTPUT filename with histogram information on
                        aggregate coverages [%s].
  --output-filename-empty=OUTPUT_FILENAME_EMPTY
                        OUTPUT filename with queries for which all matches
                        have been discarded [none].
  -o OUTPUT_FORMAT, --output-format=OUTPUT_FORMAT
                        output format to choose [map].
  -z, --from-zipped     input is zipped.
  --threshold-min-pid=THRESHOLD_MIN_PID
                        minimum thresholds for pid [30.0].
  --threshold-min-matches=THRESHOLD_MIN_MATCHES
                        minimum threshold for number of matching residues [0].
  --threshold-max-error-rate=THRESHOLD_MAX_ERROR_RATE
                        maximum threshold for error of aligned part [none].
  --threshold-good-query-coverage=THRESHOLD_GOOD_QUERY_COVERAGE
                        minimum query coverage for segments to be counted as
                        good [90.0].
  --threshold-min-query-coverage=THRESHOLD_MIN_QUERY_COVERAGE
                        minimum query coverage for segments to be accepted
                        [50].
  --threshold-max-query-gapchars=THRESHOLD_MAX_QUERY_GAPCHARS
                        maximum number of gap characters  in query[none].
  --threshold-max-query-gaps=THRESHOLD_MAX_QUERY_GAPS
                        maximum number of gaps  in query[none].
  --threshold-max-sbjct-gapchars=THRESHOLD_MAX_SBJCT_GAPCHARS
                        maximum number of gap characters  in sbjct[none].
  --keep-unique-matches
                        ignore filters for unique matches [False].
  --keep-all-best       when sorting matches, keep all matches within the
                        collection threshold [False].
  --best-per-sbjct      keep only the best entry per sbjct (for transcript
                        mapping) [False].
  --threshold-max-sbjct-gaps=THRESHOLD_MAX_SBJCT_GAPS
                        maximum number of gaps  in sbjct[none].
  --test=TEST           test - stop after # rows of parsing[none].
  -m MATCHING_MODE, --matching-mode=MATCHING_MODE
                        determines how to selecte the best match [best-
                        coverage].
  --filename-filter-sbjct=FILENAME_FILTER_SBJCT
                        gff file for filtering sbjct matches. Matches
                        overlapping these regions are discarded, but see
                        --keep-forbidden [none].
  --keep-forbidden      if set, keep only matches that overlap the regions
                        supplied with --filename-filter-sbjct [False].
  --query-forward-coordinates
                        use forward coordinates for query, strand will refer
                        to sbjct [False].
  --ignore-all-random   if there are multiple best matches, ignore all those
                        to chrUn and _random [False].
  --collection-threshold=COLLECTION_THRESHOLD
                        threshold for collecting matches, percent of best
                        score [1.0].
  --collection-distance=COLLECTION_DISTANCE
                        threshold for collecting matches, difference to best
                        score [0].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
